abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey an unsatisfactory project
            outcome, unlikely sustainability, and unsatisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower, although
            institutional development impacts were modest. Lessons
            convey that while the project estimated the risk of not
            continuing the reforms as "moderate", it provided
            relatively little technical and financial support for
            pursuing the reforms, in fact, very few of the legal and
            regulatory texts cited in the Appraisal Report ever became
            operational, and, of particular importance was the
            insufficient project preparation to follow-up on the PNAC -
            Pharmacie Nationale Approvisionnement des Comores - and to
            develop modalities for ensuring services for the poor. The
            risk should probably have been considered
            "substantial" at minimum, and appropriate measures
            should have been included, to ensure continued support and
            monitoring during implementation. Further lessons suggest
            that Project restructuring should be considered,
            particularly after long delays in implementation; regional
            specificities, even in small countries, must be taken into
            account during project preparation and implementation; where
            capacity for policy analysis and program decision-making is
            inadequate, project design and implementation must develop a
            consensus for program implementation.
